result.execSummary:
The defendant Michelle Lea Serdynski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100  including costs to be paid by 11-30-2015 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs be paid by 11-30-2015 or a civil judgment is ordered.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michelle Lea Serdynski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michelle Lea Serdynski in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered the defendant to serve 2 day in the HOC with credit for 2 days time served.  
Court orders Defendant to pay a forfeiture of $100  including costs to be paid by 11-30-2015 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs be paid by 11-30-2015 or a civil judgment is ordered.   The Court admonished the defendant that, pursuant to Federal Law, she may not possess a firearm.
Court waives the DV assessment.
Case sent to Branch 7 for plea and sentencing as this court is in trial.  rmm
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Michelle Lea Serdynski in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge dismissed and read-in to case for the purposes of sentencing.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report Violation received and filed.  (positive drug test - with valid prescription)  rmm

Defendant Michelle Lea Serdynski in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  rmm

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Barron G

Defendant Michelle Lea Serdynski in court with attorney Colin P. McGinn.  Defendant Michelle Lea Serdynski in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  State moves to amend the date in probable cause portion of the criminal complaint.  Defense does not object.  Court orders complaint amended to reflect the correct date of May 17, 2015.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
